quiz.text: Ratio of distance travelled by boat ‘P’ in upstream and downstream respectively is:
options: 7: 11
9: 11
7: 13
7: 9
None of these

quiz.text: Distance travelled by boat ‘Q’ in downstream is:
options: 90 km
150 km
180 km
120 km
None of these

quiz.text: Distance travelled by boat ‘S’ in upstream is how much percent more/less than distance travelled by the same boat in downstream?
options: 37.5 %
50 %
33.33 %
66.67 %
None of these

quiz.text: Distance travelled by boat ‘R’ in upstream is:
options: 160 km
240 km
180 km
200 km
None of these

quiz.text: If the speed of the stream for boat ‘S’ increases by 200% then find total time taken by boat ‘S’ cover the desired distance.
options: 8 hours 30 minutes
8 hours 25 minutes
8 hours 15 minutes
8 hours 45 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: A boat can cover 232 km upstream in 23.2 hours. If speed of stream is increase/decrease by _____%, then it will takes ______ hours to cover distance of 182 km downstream. Sum of speed of boat in still water and speed of stream is 26 km/h. Which of the following option will satisfy the blanks in same order? I). 25% increase, 6.5 hours II). 50% increase, 6.0667 hours (approx.) III). 37.5% decrease, 7.91 hours (approx.)
options: I only
II and III only
I, II and III
I and II only
None of these

quiz.text: Find which combination of data is true in the blank according to the question in the same sequence. Ratio of the upstream speed of the boat to the downstream speed of the boat is 3:7. Time taken by boat to cover 262.5 km in still water is 52.5 hours. Time taken by boat to cover ______km upstream is _________hours. I. 90,30 II. 22.5,7.5 III. 72, 18
options: Only I
Only I and II
Only III
All I, II and III
Only I and III

quiz.text: Downstream speed of the boat in still water is 40 km/h. A boat can cover 288 km upstream in 9 hours. If the speed of the stream is increased by _____ % then it will cover a distance of 1056 km downstream in _____ hours. Find which of the following statement(s) will satisfy the blanks. I). 200%, 22 hours II). 100%, 24 hours III). 80%, 24.33 hours
options: Only II is true
Only I and II are true
Only II and III are true
I, II, and III are true
None of these

quiz.text: Time taken by boat A to go 3.78 km downstream is 175 seconds less than that taken by boat B to go same distance upstream. If speed of boat A in still water were 12.5% more, time taken by boat A to go same distance downstream would be 189 seconds less than that taken by boat B to go upstream. If speed of stream is 3 m/s, then the time taken by boat A is _______ seconds to go 3.78 km downstream initially.
options: 140 seconds
150 seconds
110 seconds
130 seconds
120 seconds

quiz.text: Boat A and B started travelling simultaneously in upstream from same point with their speeds in still water is 50 km/h and 35 km/h, respectively. After travelling for 40 minutes an item fall from faster boat and the item started floating with stream flow of speed 5 km/h. The approximate distance between both the boats is ______ kilometers, when slower boat catches the item.
options: 18.7 km
11.2 km
16.5 km
14.3 km
20.9 km

quiz.text: Study the following information and answer the questions. Questions are given in which four statements (1), (2), (3) and (4) are given. You will have to find which statement can be determined and choose your answer accordingly. A boat running upstream takes 4 hours 45 minutes to cover a certain distance, while it takes 2 hours 30 minutes to cover the same distance running downstream. What is the ratio between speed of the water current and speed of the boat in still water respectively? 1) 27:75 2) 9:25 3) 9: 29 4) 27: 97
options: Only 1 and 2
Only 2
Only 3 and 4
Only 3
All 1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: A boat takes 8 hours to travel from point A to B in still water. 62.5% of the distance between points A to B is 330 km and then find the downstream speed of the boat. Statement I: If the time taken by boat covers 540 km downstream is equal to the time taken by boat covers 252 km upstream. Statement II: The downstream speed of the boat is 48 km/hr more than that of the upstream speed of the boat.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question
The data given in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: Time taken by boat to travel (K + 175) km upstream is 50% more than time taken by boat to travel (K + 250) km downstream. Speed of the boat in still water is four times the speed of the stream. Find which of the following statement(s) is/are true. I. Time taken by boat to travel (2K – 80) km downstream is 184/3 hours. Speed of stream is 3 km/h II. Time taken by boat to travel (K – 140) km upstream is twice of time taken by boat to travel (K/2 + 50) km downstream III. Unit digit of (K/4 + 4)99 is 9
options: II only
III only
I and II only
II and III only
All are true.

quiz.text: Speed of boat in still water of boat P is (M + 8) km/h and that of boat Q is (N – 10) km/h respectively. Upstream speed of boat P is 3R km/h more than that of boat Q. Speed of stream for both the boats is 25% of speed of boat P in still water. Find which of the following can be the downstream speed of boat Q? I. 25% of (5N + 3R – 50) II. 50% of (4N + M – 32)/2 III. (5M – 12R + 40)/4 IV. (5M + 3N – 60)/4
options: I and III only
II only
I, II, IV only
I, II, III only
None of these.

quiz.text: A boat goes (i) km downstream and comes back to the starting point in (ii) hours. If the speed of the current is (iii) , then the speed of the  boat in still water is (iv). a) i=48, ii=10, iii=4, iv=12 b) i=90,ii=6, iii=5, iv=10 c) i=96, ii=8, iii=4, iv=8
options: Only a is satisfied
Only b is satisfied
None is satisfied
Both a and b is satisfied
Both a and c is satisfied

quiz.text: In each of the following questions, two quantities I and II are given. You are expected to solve them and find the correct relation between them. Quantity I: Speed of boat in still water is 150% more than that of upstream speed. Find the time taken (in hours) by boat to travel 112 km downstream if upstream speed of boat is 20/9 m/sec. (Only numerical value) Quantity II: Total time taken by boat to travel 320 km upstream and the same distance downstream is 28 hours. Find 12.5% of speed of boat in still water (in km/h) if downstream speed of boat is 2.5 times of upstream. (Only numerical value)
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II

quiz.text: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantities on its basis. (Only Numerical value is to be considered): Upstream speed (in m/s) of a boat is 22(2/9) % of its downstream speed (in m/s). Speed of stream is a prime number but less than 10 and speed of the boat in still water is an integer. Quantity I: Find the speed of the boat in still water. Quantity II: Find the time taken by the boat to cover 270 m in the downstream direction.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II (or) relationship can't be determined

quiz.text: In each of the following questions, two quantities I and II are given. You are expected to solve them and find the correct relation between them. Quantity I: Time taken by boat to row from point P to Q is the same as the time taken by boat to row from Q to R (R is the mid-point of P and Q). If the speed of the river is 12 km/h, find the downstream speed of the Boat. Quantity II: Speed of the boat in still water is 300% more than the speed of the river. A boat can travel 976 km downstream distance in 12 hours 12 minutes, then find the upstream speed of the boat.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity I
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I and Quantity II on its basis. (Only quantity is to be considered) Quantity I: Boat A and B with still water speeds in the ratio 5 : 6 start from the same point in a river and go in opposite directions. After 6 hours they are at least 528 km apart. What will be the distance covered by boat B in a stream speed of 2km/h in 8 hours downstream? Quantity II: 400 km
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I and Quantity II on its basis. (Only quantity is to be considered) The ratio of the still water speed of a boat to the stream speed is 7 : 2. The boat can cover 270km downstream in 6 hours. Quantity I: What will be the distance covered by the boat after travelling 8 hours downstream and 6 hours upstream? Quantity II: What will be the distance covered by the boat after travelling 4 hours downstream and 12 hours upstream?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Time taken by a boat to go 168 m downstream is 4 seconds less than that taken by boat to come back and while coming back speed of stream is decreased to 75%. If speed of stream had not been decreased while coming back, difference between downstream and upstream speed of boat would be 8 m/s. Find the total time taken by boat during the whole journey?
options: 28 seconds
16 seconds
20 seconds
22 seconds
24 seconds

quiz.text: Time taken by boat P to travel from Point M to point N is 24 hours and coming back to point M is 32 hours. If the speed of boat Q in still water is half of that of boat P, and speed of stream in which boat Q is travelling is twice as that of boat P, then find how much time it will take by boat Q to cover 77 km downstream. Distance between M and N is 768 km?
options: 3.5 hours
2.5 hours
4.5 hours
1.5 hours
None of these

quiz.text: Speed of a boat in still water is 800% more than that of speed of stream. Time taken by boat to travel 2(P + 15) km downstream is 50% more than time taken by boat to travel (P + 31) km upstream. Find P% of 500.
options: 1125
1225
1275
1175
None of these

quiz.text: Time taken by a boat to cover ‘D' km upstream is 6 hours and boat covers ‘D+12’ km Downstream in 3 hours. The boat takes 13 hours to cover ‘(0.75D+4) km’ downstream and return ‘2D-8’km upstream. Find the distance covered by boat in 3 hours downstream.
options: 60 km
54 km
48 km
57 km
None of these

quiz.text: In still water, the speed of boat A is less than that of boat B and the difference in their speeds is equal to the speed of the stream. If the upstream speed of boat A is half of the downstream speed of boat B, then find the ratio of the speed of boat A to that of boat B in still water?
options: 2: 3
5: 6
Cannot be determined
3: 4
4: 5
